title: Corrie writers divided over running dark Bethany Platt sex ring plot | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 10:49 am (Picture: ITV) 
Coronation Street writers are used to tackling difficult and controversial subjects on the show but teenager Bethany Platt’s ongoing sexual exploitation story has left some of the team divided over whether the evening soap should be entering such dark territory before the watershed and how they should do it. 
Fans have been watching with horror as Bethany has been groomed by sinister Nathan and the storyline is only set to get worse as Bethany falls prey to a sex ring. Charities have praised Corrie for tackling the tough issue given the prevalence of such dangers out there for young people. 
Discussing the story at the Coronation Street: The Next 56 Years panel in Salford, in which behind the scenes staff talk openly about Corrie and the future, writer Jan McVerry explained: ‘I think it’s an important story to tell for young people, particularly those who may be lacking in self-confidence. ‘There are worries these unscrupulous bastards get in your lives and lure you away. It is a very dark subject. My own children are teenagers, but others with very young children have asked “should we be going into this darker territory?” ‘We have had many discussions on how to tell the story.’ (Picture: ITV) 
So far the story has been a slow burner as Nathan has employed devious and gaslighting tactics to groom Bethany and pull her into his murky world. And his intentions are set to be revealed in full over coming months as Bethany’s situation gets desperate.
